alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 02 at 4:56PM CDT until May 02 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL GARFIELD COUNTY... At 456 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Fairmont, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Enid, Garber, Breckenridge and Fairmont. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
